### Research Facility

### Power Generation System (Latest Configuration)
Current setup consists of:
- Steam engine at (-14.5, 15.5) facing DOWN
- Boiler at (-14.5, 19.0) containing 12 coal
- Offshore pump at (-9.5, 24.5)
- Multiple pipe groups connecting components
System partially functioning:
- Water system connected and flowing
- Steam being generated
- Steam engine not connected to power network

ERROR TIPS

### Entity Placement Conflicts
- Check target location for existing entities before placement
- Ensure sufficient clear space around placement area
- Remove blocking entities before attempting new placements

### Steam Engine Placement
- Ensure proper orientation (UP/DOWN/LEFT/RIGHT) based on connection requirements
- Clear area completely before placing steam engine
- Verify connection points alignment with boiler

### Power Network Setup
- Place electric poles at valid locations without obstructions
- Ensure proper spacing between poles to maintain network connectivity
- Connect steam engine to power network before adding consumers

### Resource Management
- Verify coal availability before attempting to fuel entities
- Maintain adequate coal supply for continuous operation
- Check inventory contents before attempting resource insertions

### Fluid System Construction
- Remove all existing pipe groups before new connections
- Create direct, minimal connections between components
- Verify fluid flow after completing connections
- Keep pipe paths short and direct
- Handle water and steam connections separately

### Entity Removal
- Verify entity exists at target location before attempting removal
- Remove all pipes before attempting new fluid connections
- Clear area completely when rebuilding systems

### Power System Construction
- Build system in correct sequence: offshore pump → boiler → steam engine → power poles
- Verify each component is working before adding the next
- Ensure proper spacing and orientation between components
- Connect power network only after fluid systems are operational
